query: Compare documentation of promised vs actual delivery dates across sources.
output:
CLAUDE CODE ANALYSIS
Query: Compare documentation of promised vs actual delivery dates across sources.

RELEVANT DOCUMENT EXCERPTS:

[NO exhibits - CITIOM EXPERT REPORT - D. Farnham Expert Report - Mar 21 2025 copy.pdf, p.16]
Gulfstream often have different cost structures and service models compared to independent

[NO exhibits - CITIOM EXPERT REPORT - D. Farnham Expert Report - Mar 21 2025 copy.pdf, p.16]
compared to independent MRO facilities. This is a factor aircraft owners must consider when

[NO exhibits - CITIOM EXPERT REPORT - D. Farnham Expert Report - Mar 21 2025 copy.pdf, p.16]
compared to independent MROs. Gulfstream's downtime and costs in these areas are often

[Bassim Draft Witness Statement.docx, p.1]
In comparing the proposals, it appeared the cost estimate contained in the Proposal (from Gulfstream US for St. Louis) was the least expensive. I understood this was likely due to lower labor rates or other efficiencies in the US compared to Europe.

[Bassim Draft Witness Statement.docx, p.1]
Gulfstream also tried to blame delays on alleged late payments by CITIOM. This is a deflection tactic. Any minor administrative delays in payments were insignificant compared to the months-long delays caused by Gulfstream's mismanagement and did not justify the catastrophic project failure.

[Gulfstream - Prehearing Brief .pdf, p.21]
outlier as compared to other G550 aircraft in the fleet.

[7. Leonard B - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Ask how his knowledge compares to Farnham, who observed all such functions on SN5174 firsthand.

[1. Bassim Haider Direct Outline with Redirect & Rehab.docx, p.1]
How did the final sale price compare to the May 2024 APA?

[Gulfstream - Prehearing Brief .pdf, p.46]
any change In relevant technical documentation which affects the Workscope.

[7. Leonard B - Cross Exam & Impeachment.docx, p.1]
Beauchemin claims to offer a reliable “technical rebuttal” to Farnham’s first-hand observations—but he never set foot in the facility and did not review CITIOM’s extensive photo documentation or daily logs.

[Charles Philipp Outline #1.docx, p.1]
Documentation shows these parts caused significant delay, and no documented effort by Philipp to mitigate this routing time.

[2. Danny Farnham Direct Outline with Cross & Redirect.docx, p.1]
Scope: Mr. Farnham was retained to assess Gulfstream’s performance during the 192-month inspection of Aircraft SN 5174. He directly observed the inspection at Gulfstream’s St. Louis facility, analyzed project documentation, and evaluated Gulfstream’s pre-inspection planning, scope estimates, corrosion handling, and adherence to industry norms.

[Leonard Beauchemin Outline #1.docx, p.1]
But Beauchemin did not review the Farnham photographic documentation, nor observe the work firsthand. Farnham was on site from Day 1 and observed execution delays, corrosion recurrence, and staffing failures in real time.



Based on document search, key findings:
- Found relevant excerpts in repository documents
- See excerpts above for specific citations
